official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Defense to carry out a pilot
		  program for investigational treatment of members of the Armed Forces for
		  traumatic brain injury and post-traumatic stress disorder.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which was referred to
			 the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Pilot program for
			 investigational treatment of members of the Armed Forces for traumatic brain
			 injury and post-traumatic stress disorder

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out a
			 five-year pilot program under which the

shall establish a process
			 through which the

shall provide payment for investigational
			 treatments (including diagnostic testing) of traumatic brain injury or
			 post-traumatic stress disorder received by members of the Armed Forces in
			 health care facilities other than military treatment facilities. Such process
			 shall provide that payment be made directly to the health care facility
			 furnishing the treatment.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for payment for a
			 treatment pursuant to

shall be subject to the following
			 conditions:

text.#text: The approval by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for any purpose and its use must comply with rules of the

applicable to investigational new drugs or
			 investigational devices.

text.#text:
Any drug or device
			 used in the treatment must be approved or cleared by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
following approval by an institutional review
			 board operating in accordance with regulations issued by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Secretary of
			 Health and Human Services

text.#text:
The treatment must
			 be approved by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as a
			 result of the treatment on one or more of the following:

text.#text:
The patient receiving the treatment must
			 demonstrate an improvement under criteria approved by the

Standardized
			 independent pre-treatment and post-treatment neuropsychological testing.

Accepted survey
			 instruments including, such instruments that look at quality of life.

Neurological
			 imaging.

Clinical
			 examination.

The patient
			 receiving the treatment must be receiving the treatment voluntarily and based
			 on informed consent.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or eligible to enroll under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
part B, of title
			 XVIII of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
The patient
			 receiving the treatment may not be a retired member of the Armed Forces who is
			 entitled to benefits under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may establish additional restrictions or conditions for reimbursement
			 as the

determines appropriate to ensure the protection of human
			 research subjects, appropriate fiscal management, and the validity of the
			 research results.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make payments under
			 this section for treatments received by members of the Armed Forces using the
			 authority in

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
reimbursement rate
			 in effect for appropriate treatment codes for the State or territory in which

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

A payment under this section shall be made

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 develop and maintain a database containing data from each patient case
			 involving the use of a treatment under this section. The

shall ensure
			 that the database preserves confidentiality and that any use of the database or
			 disclosures of such data are limited to such use and disclosures permitted by
			 law and applicable regulations.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall ensure that an Internet
			 website of the Department of Defense includes a list of all civilian
			 institutional review board studies that have received a payment under this

header.#text:
Publication of

Assistance for
			 members To obtain treatment

of a military department may assign a member of the Armed Forces under the
			 jurisdiction of the

to temporary duty or allow the member a
			 permissive temporary duty in order to permit the member to receive treatment
			 for traumatic brain injury or post-traumatic stress disorder, for which
			 payments shall be made under

, at a location beyond reasonable
			 commuting distance of the permanent duty station of the member.

text.#text: The

A member who is away from the permanent station of the
			 member may be paid a per diem in lieu of subsistence in an amount not more than
			 the amount to which the member would be entitled if the member were performing
			 travel in connection with a temporary duty assignment.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may waive any rule of the

regarding ethics or the receipt of gifts with respect to
			 any assistance provided to a member of the Armed Forces for travel or per diem
			 expenses incidental to receiving treatment under this section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall enter into memoranda of
			 understandings with civilian institutions for the purpose of providing members
			 of the Armed Forces with treatment carried out by civilian health care
			 practitioners under treatment—

text.#text: The

approved by and
			 under the oversight of civilian institutional review boards; and

that would qualify
			 for payment under this section.

shall establish a
			 process to notify members of the Armed Forces of the opportunity to receive

shall submit to
